title: Airplanes and Spaceships
alt: Despite having now taken three months longer than the airplane people, we're making disappointingly little progress toward the obvious next stage of vehicle: The Unobtanium-hulled tunneling ship from the 2003 film 'The Core.'
transcript:
[A timeline is shown with three dots on it. Each dot has a label beneath the dot, and the two intervals between the dots are also labeled, with lines indicating which dots are belonging to that label.]Dot 1
 
December 17, 1903 
First human airplane flightDot 2
 
April 12, 1961
First human spaceflightDot 3
 
TodayInterval 1-2
 57 years 4 months
Interval 2-3
 57 years 7 months[Caption beneath the frame:]
Spaceships are now older than airplanes were when we flew our first spaceships.
